subject: Dogs
Fines (Penalties)
lead_paragraph: Giants middle linebacker Antonio Pierce pleaded guilty Thursday in Monroe Township, N.J., municipal court to neglecting his pet pit bulls and agreed to pay a $1,300 fine. Authorities said one of the dogs was severely underweight and had a respiratory illness. They also said Pierce and his girlfriend let the dogs run loose and failed to get them rabies shots. Pierce’s girlfriend, Jocelyn Maldanado, also pleaded guilty and was fined $1,300. A lawyer for the couple said the dogs were given away as part of the plea agreement. The dogs were discovered running around a neighbor’s yard in late January, the week before the Giants upset the Patriots in the Super Bowl.
